transcript.content: And y'know, you put a lot of thought into buying presents, don't you when you're a kid because you know, you haven't got that much money to spend an' that.
So you look like you did but you had hair I assume?
Yep, right. So eight years old an' that, I'm putting a bit of planning into it thinking 'Oh, you know, what does- what will me mam want?'
Now me mam's a big fan of er... gnomes
She must be pleased how you turned out
-and fairies and stuff like that, right? Little elves and all that stuff, right?
So I thought, right? I'll look for something that's, that's, a bit gnomish.
And there was this shop- there was this- there was this- there was this shop sort of down the road that, umm, sort of sold a lot of tat right?
Umm, Sort of- you know one of them shops where everything's quite cheap, it's... sort of they sell things individually, that shouldn't be like, toilet rolls, and...
They used to be called 'everything's a pound' but now there's some that are 'everything's 99p'.
Because a pound wasn't cheap enough.

So anyway. So I had a look in there thinking, 'right, let's have a look and see if they've got any gnomes an' that' and the closest thing they 'ad, right? Was uh, this, this figure that's called uh, a Victoria Plum.
No, Victoria Plum, get it right
It's like little-  it's like a- it's like a woman gnome, right?

So I thought 'Oh she'll love that, right?' So save that- I think it was about two quid, right? Invest in one of them; take it home, I'm well chuffed in myself an' that; wrapping it up, pop it under the tree thinking I can't wait to see her face light up when she sees this.
Anyway, you know like when you're a kid- I bought that like two weeks before Christmas.
Right. And you know, when you're sort of excited you want to give someone a present earlier, d' y'know what I mean?

I- I- I sort of took me mam into this shop. Aright? And we're just walking about, and the Victoria Plum was sort of there on the shelf. And I said to her, I said, 'Oh,' I said 'look at that up there, do you like that?' She said 'no, it's bloody horrible.' Right?
Ricky and Steve exclaim in horror
So this is- it's too late, it's too late to go back.
It's wrapped, I've- money's spent, it's wrapped, it's under the tree. Alright,
I'm thinking, 'Oh, I can't believe it.' So I said 'no that-' y'know, made sure she's looking at the right thing- I said 'No, that- that little gnome woman.' - 'Yeah, it's horrible.'
She opens hers an' that and she went 'oh, that's- that's lovely, that' I said 'No- uh- don't give me that,' d' y'know what I mean? 'you said you thought it was horrible-'
You thought she was a liar.
For pretending, for not wanting to hurt your feelings, she was a liar.
And that's.. you know, that's... that's why, y'know-
What're you on about? Yeah, but you don't forget, do ya?
You- I don't- I still don't know how this justifies you not buying your girlfriend of 11 years, an actual gift.
Play a Christmas song, I'm welling up.
Frank Sinatra - Let Me Try Again
Let Me Try Again, by Frank Sinatra. Beautiful song.
On, er, BBC Radio 2. Well, it's that time of year when we give- give gifts.
Right I'm making a note of this.
I've got it. I've got it.
Right. Put that on a spider's house. Right? Second one, Diana Ross isn't feeling that good. Right?
Yeah, that's the clue - I.D. Right? Diana Ross isn't feeling that sort-of good at the moment.
Different different. How can it be cryptic if the clues different the next time?
Diana Ross isn't feeling that good I.D.
That stuff that I put on my toast, right?
It doesn't taste sharp enough. Right? That stuff I put on my toast - aww (makes tasting noises). It doesn't taste, doesn't taste sharp enough right.
Bob Holness eat your heart out.
The initials J.B. Alright, so there you go, there's three Clues.
Right! I've got that, and it doesn't work!
Karl and Steve talk over each other
Hang on a sec Karl, let me give out how these people can get in touch.
Because I know you're excited to do the clues again.
You can text us 88-2-91. You can give us a call 0500-2-88-2-91 or you can email gervais@bbc.co.uk. The clues again then Karl.
Well quickly, that information card, you get on your mobile, just pop it on a spider's house. That's S.W.
Second one - Diana, Ross isn't, isn't, you know, feeling that good at the moment what's up with her?
And then the last one - that stuff I put on my toast doesn't sort of taste sharp enough, right? It's going on there, J.B.

T-Rex Christmas Bop on Radio 2, after the news we've got the answers to Rockbusters. Good luck with that, still time to get those answers in. Plus we've also got some more stuff to give away, second competition, and, of course Monkey News. If you've never had a monkey news before, you will not believe your luck, it is truly extraordinary Rick am I right?
You are, but this is the real news on 88 to 91 FM. This is Radio 2 from the BBC.

Talk by Coldplay. And we've got some Coldplay stuff to give away in this in the second hour, coming up soon. Some Collectibles and some signed stuff - albums and everything. But this is the Madonna one, we're playing for the Madonna gold disc
Is that better or better than [inaudible]?
Well it's a goal one but I just got the shop to put, write, platinum on it.
Yeah, so it's a wonderful gift, so whoever wins this is sorted out and we got some other stuff that me and Steve have made, for you, as well. So Karl give us the clues again and the answers.
This is it Karl, this is the final moment where we actually get to see how your mind works.
And you've got a winner and everything [inaudible]. Right, first one was  - you know that that little card you get in your mobile? Yeah you put that?
Yeah, okay so I got that one.
Yeah so it's web. It's SIM-on-web.
SIM-on-web - I've never heard of 'im. I've never heard of SIM-on-web.

No. No it's not [inaudible] carry on because again it's absolute rubbish. That didn't happen. There's no way they'd hire a chimp and there's no way people go... THEY'D NOTICE. THEY'D SEE IT WAS A CHIMP!
Right, forget it then. that they do is they see it was a joke.
It's absolute rubbish. If you want to find out more about Karl, what's the website address Karl?
And we've drawn-I've drawn a little picture that you can win a Karl and it really sums him up.

synopsis.description: Karl tells a Dickensian story about buying his mother a Victoria Plum Gnome for Christmas.
